page.title: 12A COUNCIL WORKER
page.content: Mr.Langdon joined Yeovil Borough Council in June 1947.The only Council Transport then was horses and carts.He joined at 25,and for his first week had to empty bins.From 1947-61 Mr.Langdon carried out Roadworks,Pipe laying,Pavement laying,Tarmacing and Stone pitching,putting stones upon their edges ,something like cobbles. When the Council turned District Mr.Langdon drove his first truck.At this time they were using Steam-driven rollers for Tarmacing.During his time with the Borouh and District,Mr. Langdon had to do jobs like staying out all day and night fixing burst mains,getting up at 4am in the morning to sand snow covered roads,he also had to be out by 5am on Sundays to sweep the roads.Mr.Langdon retired in 1980 wih 36 years on the Yeovil Council behind him.
